histore.archive.manager.db.base module¶

Manager for archives that maintains all archive metadata in a relational database.

class histore.archive.manager.db.base.DBArchiveManager(basedir: Optional[str] = None, db: Optional[histore.archive.manager.db.database.DB] = None, create: Optional[bool] = False)¶

Bases: histore.archive.manager.base.ArchiveManager

The database archive manager maintains a set of archives on disk. The list of archive descriptors is maintained in a relational database.

archives() → Dict[str, histore.archive.manager.descriptor.ArchiveDescriptor]¶

Get dictionary of archive descriptors. The returned dictionary maps archive identifier to their descriptor.

Returns

dict(string

Return type

histore.archive.manager.descriptor.ArchiveDescriptor)

create(name: Optional[str] = None, description: Optional[str] = None, encoder: Optional[str] = None, decoder: Optional[str] = None, serializer: Optional[Union[Dict, Callable]] = None, doc: Optional[Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, str, histore.document.base.Document]] = None, primary_key: Optional[Union[str, List[str]]] = None, snapshot: Optional[histore.document.base.InputDescriptor] = None, sorted: Optional[bool] = False, buffersize: Optional[float] = None, validate: Optional[bool] = False) → histore.archive.manager.descriptor.ArchiveDescriptor¶

Create a new archive object under a given unique name.

For archives that are keyed by a primary key, the input document for the first dataset snapshot has to be provided. This snapshot will be loaded into the archive.

Raises a ValueError if an archive with the given name exists.

Parameters

  • name (string, default=None) – Descriptive name that is associated with the archive.

  • description (string, default=None) – Optional long description that is associated with the archive.

  • encoder (string, default=None) – Full package path for the Json encoder class that is used by the persistent archive.

  • decoder (string, default=None) – Full package path for the Json decoder function that is used by the persistent archive.

  • serializer (dict or callable, default=None) – Dictionary or callable that returns a dictionary that contains the specification for the serializer. The serializer specification is a dictionary with the following elements: - clspath: Full package target path for the serializer class that is instantiated. - kwargs : Additional arguments that are passed to the constructor of the created serializer instance. Only clspath is required.

  • doc (histore.archive.base.InputDocument, default=None) – Input document representing the initial dataset snapshot that is being loaded into the archive.

  • primary_key (string or list, default=None) – Column(s) that are used to generate identifier for snapshot rows.

  • snapshot (histore.document.base.InputDescriptor, default=None) – Optional metadata for the created snapshot.

  • sorted (bool, default=False) – Flag indicating if the document is sorted by the optional primary key attributes. Ignored if the archive is not keyed.

  • buffersize (float, default=None) – Maximum size (in bytes) for the memory buffer when sorting the input document.

  • validate (bool, default=False) – Validate that the resulting archive is in proper order before committing the action.

Returns

Return type

histore.archive.manager.descriptor.ArchiveDescriptor

Raises

ValueError –

  • name (string) – New archive name.
